## Type of Change

<!-- Mark the relevant option with an "x" -->

- [ ] `fix`: Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] `feat`: New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] `docs`: Documentation update
- [ ] `refactor`: Code refactoring (no functional changes)
- [ ] `test`: Adding or updating tests
- [ ] `chore`: Maintenance or tooling changes
- [ ] `perf`: Performance improvement
- [ ] `ci`: CI/CD changes
- [ ] `build`: Build system or dependency updates
- [ ] **Breaking change** (requires `!` in commit or `BREAKING CHANGE:` footer)

<!-- Link to related issues using #issue_number -->

## Testing

<!-- Describe how you tested your changes -->

- [ ] Added new tests for changes
- [ ] Manual testing performed

## Conventional Commits Checklist

<!-- Verify your commits follow the Conventional Commits specification -->

- [ ] All commit messages follow the format: `<type>(<optional scope>): <description>`
- [ ] Commit type is one of: `feat`, `fix`, `docs`, `chore`, `refactor`, `test`, `ci`, `build`, `perf`, `revert`
- [ ] Commit description is in imperative mood (e.g., "add feature" not "added feature")
- [ ] Breaking changes are marked with `!` after type/scope OR include `BREAKING CHANGE:` footer
- [ ] Commit scope (if used) is lowercase and concise

**See [commit-instructions.md](https://github.com/alexdresko/collection-merger/blob/main/docs/commit-instructions.md) for detailed guidelines.**
